column1: Beets—Average retail price per pound and per cup equivalent, 2016

1The liquid contents of the can are discarded prior to consumption. Based on the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED), ERS assumes that 65 percent of the can's gross weight is solid and 35 percent is liquid medium. The FPED cup equivalent weight for canned beets is the weight of solids and not of the liquid medium in which the vegetable is packed. The preparation yield factor for canned beets in the above table does not account for any further preparation that occurs prior to consumption.

Source: Calculated by USDA, Economic Research Service, from 2016 IRI Infoscan data; and the Food Patterns Equivalents Database (FPED) 2013-14 as well as the FPED's accompanying Methodology and User Guide.
